Job Position: Commercial Manager
Job Location:&nbsp;Gbagada, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	We are seeking a dynamic, results-driven Commercial Manager to lead and manage our commercial operations within the healthcare sector.
	The ideal candidate will have a proven track record in sales, client relationship management, and strategic business development.
	You will be responsible for driving revenue growth, managing key accounts, delivering impactful presentations, and working cross-functionally to support business expansion.


Key Responsibilities
Sales &amp; Business Development:


	Develop and execute commercial strategies aligned with company objectives.
	Identify new business opportunities and drive sales growth across healthcare segments (e.g., hospitals, clinics, diagnostics, pharma, medical devices, etc.).
	Prepare and present commercial proposals, tenders, and pricing models.
	Achieve sales targets, revenue goals, and market share growth.


Client Relationship Management:


	Build and maintain strong, long-term relationships with key clients, stakeholders, and partners.
	Serve as the main point of contact for high-value clients, ensuring satisfaction and retention.
	Resolve client issues with a proactive and service-oriented approach.


Presentations &amp; Communication:


	Deliver high-quality presentations and product/service demonstrations to stakeholders, clients, and internal teams.
	Represent the company at conferences, trade shows, and industry events.


Commercial Strategy &amp; Reporting:


	Analyze market trends, competitor activity, and customer feedback to refine commercial strategies.
	Prepare sales forecasts, budget plans, and performance reports for senior leadership.


Qualifications


	Bachelor&rsquo;s degree in Business, Healthcare Management or a related field.
	3+ years of experience in a commercial/sales role within the healthcare or medical industry.
	Proven experience in B2B, B2C sales, contract negotiation, and client account management.
	Strong presentation, communication, and interpersonal skills.
	Excellent analytical and strategic thinking abilities.
	Familiarity with CRM systems and sales performance tools.


Preferred Skills:


	Understanding of healthcare processes and healthcare ecosystem.
	Experience working with hospitals, payers, or healthcare providers.
	Knowledge of relevant regulatory and compliance frameworks (e.g., HIPAA, local health authority regulations).


Method of Application

        Wellness Health Insurance is a leading HMO service provider in Nigeria, committed to revolutionizing healthcare financing and delivery in the country.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Commercial Manager
Job Location: Gbagada, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	We are seeking a dynamic, results-driven Commercial Manager to lead and manage our commercial operations within the healthcare sector.
	The ideal candidate will have a proven track record in sales, client relationship management, and strategic business development.
	You will be responsible for driving revenue growth, managing key accounts, delivering impactful presentations, and working cross-functionally to support business expansion.


Key Responsibilities
Sales & Business Development:


	Develop and execute commercial strategies aligned with company objectives.
	Identify new business opportunities and drive sales growth across healthcare segments (e.g., hospitals, clinics, diagnostics, pharma, medical devices, etc.).
	Prepare and present commercial proposals, tenders, and pricing models.
	Achieve sales targets, revenue goals, and market share growth.


Client Relationship Management:


	Build and maintain strong, long-term relationships with key clients, stakeholders, and partners.
	Serve as the main point of contact for high-value clients, ensuring satisfaction and retention.
	Resolve client issues with a proactive and service-oriented approach.


Presentations & Communication:


	Deliver high-quality presentations and product/service demonstrations to stakeholders, clients, and internal teams.
	Represent the company at conferences, trade shows, and industry events.


Commercial Strategy & Reporting:


	Analyze market trends, competitor activity, and customer feedback to refine commercial strategies.
	Prepare sales forecasts, budget plans, and performance reports for senior leadership.


Qualifications


	Bachelor’s degree in Business, Healthcare Management or a related field.
	3+ years of experience in a commercial/sales role within the healthcare or medical industry.
	Proven experience in B2B, B2C sales, contract negotiation, and client account management.
	Strong presentation, communication, and interpersonal skills.
	Excellent analytical and strategic thinking abilities.
	Familiarity with CRM systems and sales performance tools.


Preferred Skills:


	Understanding of healthcare processes and healthcare ecosystem.
	Experience working with hospitals, payers, or healthcare providers.
	Knowledge of relevant regulatory and compliance frameworks (e.g., HIPAA, local health authority regulations).

	The HSE Project Lead will be responsible for developing, implementing, and monitoring health, safety, and environmental (HSE) strategies to ensure compliance with local and international safety standards.
	The role requires strong leadership in enforcing safety procedures, conducting risk assessments, and driving a proactive safety culture across project sites.


Key Responsibilities


	Ensure full compliance with all HSE regulations, standards, and policies (e.g., ISO, OSHA, DPR).
	Develop, implement, and maintain safety procedures, training programs, and emergency response plans.

	Monitor and analyze safety performance metrics, ensuring continuous improvement.
	Conduct routine site inspections, hazard identification, and risk assessments.
	Advise project teams and management on best practices to minimize workplace hazards.
	Coordinate and supervise HSE Officers, subcontractors, and other stakeholders to maintain safe work conditions.
	Conduct regular safety audits and compliance reviews to ensure adherence to HSE standards.

	Bachelor&rsquo;s degree in Environmental Science, Engineering, Occupational Health &amp; Safety, or related field.
	4&ndash;7 years of relevant experience in HSE management within the Oil &amp; Gas industry.
	Strong knowledge of ISO 45001, ISO 14001, and other applicable HSE frameworks.
	Proven experience leading safety initiatives in large-scale projects.
	Excellent communication, leadership, and reporting skills.
	Professional HSE certifications (e.g., NEBOSH, IOSH, ISPON) are an added advantage.


Method of Application&nbsp;

Job Location:&nbsp;Ijora, Lagos

	Assess the adequacy of existing technical and non-technical controls to ensure compliance with applicable laws and requirements.
	Update Risk Register and Monitor Key Risk Indicators.
	Identify control gaps and recommend compensating controls while also supporting the process owners in the development and implementation.
	Assist in coordinating day-to-day performance and quality monitoring exercises, implementing effective, proactive, quality processes at the operating level that will positively impact quality and enhance stakeholder satisfaction.
	Review the existence and operating effectiveness of compliance controls.
	Document and Update Standard Operating Procedures across board.
	Support with activities to create company-wide awareness of regulatory and statutory requirements and the importance of complying with these requirements.
	Produce high-quality reports and analysis with insights on compliance monitoring activities, outcomes and trends.


Requirements

	2 - 3 years of experience in Risk Management, internal controls, compliance and audit.

	Professional qualification/Certifications in one or more of ICAN, ACCA, CFA, CMA etc. is an added advantage.
	Strong knowledge of internal controls.
	Experience working in a highly regulated environment.
	Strong and effective business communication (verbal and writing skills).
	Ability to plan and execute numerous complex projects while managing tight deadlines and challenging circumstances.
	Strong analytical skills.

Risk & Compliance Officer Job at Sahara Group




        
    

        
        Sahara Group is a leading international energy and infrastructure conglomerate with operations in over 38 countries across Africa, Middle East, Europe and Asia. Spanning three decades, we have broken ground and challenged stereotypes across the global business landscape. The women and men who make up our organization are our strongest levers for growth.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Risk & Compliance Officer

Job Identification: 412
Job Location: Ijora, Lagos
Employment Type: Full Time

Role Accountabilities

	Assess the adequacy of existing technical and non-technical controls to ensure compliance with applicable laws and requirements.
	Update Risk Register and Monitor Key Risk Indicators.
	Identify control gaps and recommend compensating controls while also supporting the process owners in the development and implementation.
	Assist in coordinating day-to-day performance and quality monitoring exercises, implementing effective, proactive, quality processes at the operating level that will positively impact quality and enhance stakeholder satisfaction.
	Review the existence and operating effectiveness of compliance controls.
	Document and Update Standard Operating Procedures across board.
	Support with activities to create company-wide awareness of regulatory and statutory requirements and the importance of complying with these requirements.
	Produce high-quality reports and analysis with insights on compliance monitoring activities, outcomes and trends.


Requirements


	BSc Degree in any numerate course from an accredited University.
	2 - 3 years of experience in Risk Management, internal controls, compliance and audit.
	2-3 years of experience in Data processing, Data Analytics/analysis, Compliance management, Quality assurance etc.
	Minimum of 2 years of combined IT experience with a broad range of exposure to IT Governance, internal audit, compliance and systems analysis.
	Professional qualification/Certifications in one or more of ICAN, ACCA, CFA, CMA etc. is an added advantage.
	Strong knowledge of internal controls.
	Experience working in a highly regulated environment.
	Strong and effective business communication (verbal and writing skills).
	Ability to plan and execute numerous complex projects while managing tight deadlines and challenging circumstances.
	Strong analytical skills.
